examples.text: **Keep** the door **closed**.
He was slumped in a chair and his eyes were closed.
Store any leftovers in a closed container in the fridge.
Her eyes were half closed.
Her mouth was tightly closed.
Keep that door closed, will you?
Make sure the lid is completely closed.
She was squinting through almost closed eyes.
The sun streamed through the partially closed blinds.
The valve can be adjusted from fully open to fully closed.

definitions.definition: shut, especially of a shop or public building that is not open for a period of time

examples.text: The museum is closed on Mondays.
This road is closed to traffic.
The park was closed to the public.
The building is closed for repairs.
The library will remain closed until next week.
Twenty miles of beaches were officially closed to the public.

definitions.definition: not willing to accept outside influences or new ideas

examples.text: a closed society
He has a closed mind.

definitions.definition: limited to a particular group of people; not open to everyone

examples.text: a closed membership

definitions.definition: without the public being allowed to attend or know what is happening; in private

examples.text: The meeting was held behind closed doors.

definitions.definition: a subject or person that you know nothing about

examples.text: Nuclear physics is a closed book to most of us.

definitions.definition: very easily, without thinking about it

examples.text: I've made this trip so often, I could do it with my eyes shut.
